Posts.Content: Hello this is my first post. Was told I had prostate cancer on our anniversary 12/15/16 Had the cancer removed at MDAnderson the day my birthday 3/28/2017. So I am just beginning this adventure. Any advice will be welcome!!!
Posts.Title: Hello first post

Posts.Content: Some background: I am 68 years old, retired, married to a wonderful lady. We have one son and two grandchildren. I have two daughters from my first marriage. Three grandchildren. Was diagnose with prostate cancer on 12/15/2016 Gleason score of 3+4 (our 37th anniversary). Went to MD Anderson Houston, TX in January of 2017 and met with Dr. John Ward. Decided on the surgery and set the date (3/29/2017, day after my 68 birthday) Had prostate removed. Robotic Surgery. Dr. Ward was able to spar all the nerves. No disease present in the lymph nodes and surgical margins or free of cancer. Will go back on May 18 for PSA, finger crossed that it will be 0. Removed catheter removed May 12. Going through about six or seven depends a day....... no bladder control Been looking some of the post on bladder control and ED........ most are saying on the bladder control issue it will come back. Will work about ED problem if needed. Just want out of the depends right now.

Posts.Title: Hello first post

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by MRJ I tried it for a few days. It does get cramped, but the larger issue was keeping the pad in place. If you use the sticky strip on the pad, it will tear the inside of the briefs on removal. I will be 5 weeks out from surgery 5/03 While control is getting better, I still need pads and briefs. But like you said it does get cramped, so I thought about just wearing briefs at home and pads and briefs when we go out (easy just to change pads in public restroom).
Posts.Title: Depends pads and briefs?

Posts.Content: Does anyone wear the briefs and a pad at the same time, or is that to much to wear at the same time?
Posts.Title: Depends pads and briefs?

Posts.Content: Welcome. This is a good group to join. Had my surgery will be three weeks next Wed. Have gotten some great advice from this group. Looking forward to joining the "0" club in May, that's when I go for my post op check up.
Posts.Title: Hello from the Other Side (of Surgery)

Posts.Content: Welcome. This is a good group to join. Had my surgery will be three weeks next Wed. Have gotten some great advice from this group. Looking forward to joining the "0" club in May, that's when I go for my post op check up.
Posts.Title: Hello from the Other Side (of Surgery)

Posts.Content: ED problem still, but showing a little life!!! Using pump to exercise but still have some leaking when in use. Staying dry all night!!! Using maybe three large pads during the day. Some leaking when lifting or getting up to quick. Have not tried going with out the pads. Just taking this one day at a time. From what I have read on here, I seem to be right on target. Thanks for all the support!!!
Posts.Title: Just a short 4 month update

Posts.Content: Was given a Pos-T-Vac by my Doctor. This is for Penile Rehabilitation not intercourse for now. Anybody on here used this and what did you think? Was told this was maintain blood flow to the penis.
Posts.Title: ED question?

Posts.Content: Going to Houston for first visit after surgery on 5/18/17. Will get first PSA and seen my Doctor. HOPE it is"0"!!! Had surgery 3/29/17......so far everything seems to be on schedule. Incontinence is getting better....but not what I would like. ED, I will worry about that when I get incontinence under control. What question should I ask the Doctor as far as what to expect, when can I start back on some kind of exercise, or what kind of exercise or things my wife and I can do to get ED under control.
Posts.Title: Headed to Houston......PostOpat MD Anderson

Posts.Content: PSA came back undetectable!!! Will check again in 6 months. I can start getting back to a normal routine.
Posts.Title: New Member of the "0" Club!!!!

Posts.Content: PSA came back undetectable!!! Will check again in 6 months. I can start getting back to a normal routine.
Posts.Title: New Member of the "0" Club!!!!
